job_description:
Drive the innovation and application of cutting-edge AI models to solve real-world business problems. As an Applied AI Research Scientist, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and deploying AI solutions, primarily focusing on machine learning, deep learning, and natural language processing. Your responsibilities will include: conducting literature reviews and staying up-to-date on the latest advancements in AI; building and training machine learning models using frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn; developing and implementing data pipelines for data acquisition, cleaning, and transformation; evaluating model performance and iterating on design based on results; collaborating with product managers and engineers to integrate AI solutions into existing products and services; contributing to the development of internal AI infrastructure and tools; writing technical reports and publications to document research findings; and presenting research at internal and external conferences.

Requirements: A Master's or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field is required. 3+ years of experience in developing and deploying machine learning models in a practical setting. Strong programming skills in Python and experience with machine learning libraries (TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn). Deep understanding of statistical modeling, machine learning algorithms, and deep learning architectures. Experience with data manipulation and analysis using tools like Pandas and NumPy. Excellent communication and collaboration skills. Experience with cloud computing platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) is a plus. Familiarity with MLOps principles and tools is highly desirable. A proven track record of publishing research papers or contributing to open-source projects is an advantage. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently and as part of a team.

As an Applied AI Research Scientist, you will be at the forefront of developing and implementing cutting-edge AI solutions for real-world problems. You will work within a dynamic team of researchers and engineers to translate theoretical AI advancements into tangible products and services. Responsibilities include: conducting research on novel AI algorithms and techniques, particularly in areas like computer vision, natural language processing, and deep learning; developing and prototyping AI models using frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Keras; designing and implementing scalable AI infrastructure for training and deployment; collaborating with product managers and engineers to integrate AI solutions into existing products and new initiatives; publishing research findings in peer-reviewed conferences and journals; mentoring junior researchers and engineers; staying up-to-date with the latest advancements in the AI field; and contributing to the overall AI strategy of the company. Requirements include: a PhD in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or a related field; strong theoretical foundation in AI and machine learning principles; proven experience in developing and implementing AI models using deep learning techniques; proficiency in programming languages such as Python, C++, or Java; experience with cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP); excellent communication and collaboration skills; a strong publication record in top-tier AI conferences and journals is a plus; and experience with deploying AI models to production environments is highly desirable.

The AI Solutions Architect is responsible for designing, developing, and implementing scalable and robust AI solutions that address complex business challenges. This role requires a deep understanding of machine learning algorithms, data engineering principles, and cloud infrastructure. Responsibilities include collaborating with stakeholders to define AI requirements, evaluating and selecting appropriate AI technologies, building end-to-end AI pipelines (data ingestion, feature engineering, model training, deployment, and monitoring), ensuring data quality and security, and providing technical leadership to a team of data scientists and engineers.

**Requirements:**

*   Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field (Master's preferred).
*   5+ years of experience in developing and deploying AI/ML solutions in a production environment.
*   Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python and frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learn.
*   Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP) and their AI/ML services.
*   Solid understanding of data engineering principles, data warehousing, and ETL processes.
*   Experience with designing and implementing REST APIs and microservices.
*   Excellent communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills.
*   Experience with MLOps principles and tools (e.g., Kubeflow, MLflow) is a plus.
*   Familiarity with different AI model types (e.g., computer vision, natural language processing, time series analysis) and their applications.
*   Ability to translate business requirements into technical specifications.
*   Experience working in an Agile development environment.

The Applied AI Scientist - Computer Vision will be responsible for researching, developing, and deploying cutting-edge computer vision solutions to real-world business problems. This role requires a strong foundation in machine learning and deep learning techniques, with a focus on image recognition, object detection, image segmentation, and video analytics.

**Responsibilities:**

*   Design, develop, and implement AI models and algorithms for computer vision tasks, including image classification, object detection, semantic segmentation, instance segmentation, and video analysis.
*   Conduct research and experimentation to explore novel approaches and improve the accuracy and efficiency of existing computer vision models.
*   Collect, clean, and pre-process large datasets of images and videos for model training and evaluation.
*   Train, evaluate, and fine-tune deep learning models using frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar.
*   Collaborate with software engineers to deploy AI models into production environments and integrate them with existing systems.
*   Work closely with product managers to understand business requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
*   Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in computer vision, machine learning, and deep learning.
*   Document research findings, model performance, and deployment procedures.
*   Contribute to the development of intellectual property and patent applications.

**Requirements:**

*   Master's or Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or a related field.
*   3+ years of experience in developing and deploying computer vision solutions.
*   Strong programming skills in Python.
*   Proficiency in deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Keras.
*   Solid understanding of convolutional neural networks (CNNs), recurrent neural networks (RNNs), and other deep learning architectures.
*   Experience with image processing libraries such as OpenCV.
*   Experience with cloud computing platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP.
*   Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
*   Strong communication and collaboration skills.
*   Experience with MLOps practices and deploying models to production environments.
*   Experience with working in Agile development environments.
*   Experience with model optimization techniques (e.g., quantization, pruning).

Applied AI Engineer - Conversational AI is responsible for the design, development, and deployment of innovative and scalable conversational AI solutions. This role involves leveraging large language models (LLMs), natural language understanding (NLU), and natural language generation (NLG) techniques to build engaging and effective chatbot and voice assistant experiences.

**Responsibilities:**

*   Develop and implement conversational AI models and systems using LLMs and related AI technologies.
*   Design and build conversational flows, dialog management systems, and personalized user experiences.
*   Train, evaluate, and fine-tune AI models for improved accuracy and performance in conversational tasks.
*   Work with stakeholders to define project requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria.
*   Integrate conversational AI solutions with various backend systems and data sources.
*   Monitor and analyze the performance of deployed conversational AI systems, identifying areas for improvement.
*   Conduct research and experimentation to explore new AI techniques and approaches for enhancing conversational AI capabilities.
*   Collaborate with a team of data scientists, engineers, and product managers to deliver high-quality AI solutions.
*   Document technical specifications, code, and deployment procedures.
*   Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in conversational AI, LLMs, and related fields.

**Requirements:**

*   Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Natural Language Processing, or a related field.
*   3+ years of experience in developing and deploying AI models and systems, with a focus on conversational AI.
*   Strong programming skills in Python and experience with relevant AI/ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Transformers).
*   Experience with LLMs (e.g., GPT, BERT, LaMDA) and their application to conversational tasks.
*   Solid understanding of NLU, NLG, dialog management, and related AI concepts.
*   Experience with chatbot platforms and frameworks (e.g., Rasa, Dialogflow, Microsoft Bot Framework).
*   Proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools (e.g., Pandas, Matplotlib, Seaborn).
*   Experience with cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and deployment of AI models in the cloud.
*   Excellent communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills.
*   Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
*   Experience with A/B testing and iterative improvement of AI models is a plus.
*   Experience with prompt engineering and fine-tuning LLMs for specific use cases is a plus.

The Telehealth Nurse Navigator serves as a vital link between patients, providers, and the telehealth platform, ensuring seamless and effective virtual care delivery. This role is responsible for proactively guiding patients through the telehealth process, providing technical support, and facilitating communication to optimize the patient experience. Responsibilities include: triaging patient inquiries received via phone, email, or the telehealth platform; assessing patient needs and determining the appropriate level of care (e.g., scheduled virtual appointment, urgent virtual visit, referral to in-person care); providing technical assistance to patients accessing the telehealth platform, troubleshooting basic issues, and educating patients on the use of telehealth technology; coordinating virtual appointments, including pre-visit preparation, post-visit follow-up, and medication refills; monitoring patient engagement with the telehealth platform and identifying opportunities to improve utilization and adherence; documenting all patient interactions and interventions in the electronic health record (EHR); collaborating with physicians, specialists, and other healthcare professionals to ensure coordinated and comprehensive care; and adhering to all HIPAA regulations and maintaining patient confidentiality. Requirements include: Registered Nurse (RN) license in good standing; a minimum of 2 years of experience in direct patient care; strong computer literacy and comfort with telehealth technologies; excellent communication, interpersonal, and problem-solving skills; the ability to work independently and as part of a team; knowledge of medical terminology and clinical workflows; experience with electronic health records (EHRs); and the ability to provide empathetic and culturally sensitive care. Experience with telehealth platforms or remote patient monitoring is preferred.

job_title: Telemedicine Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner (PMHNP)
job_description:
The Telemedicine Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner (PMHNP) provides comprehensive psychiatric and mental health services to patients remotely via secure video conferencing technology. This role encompasses assessment, diagnosis, treatment planning, medication management, and psychoeducation for patients of all ages and backgrounds struggling with various mental health conditions. Responsibilities include: conducting initial psychiatric evaluations via telehealth; developing and implementing individualized treatment plans in collaboration with patients and their families; prescribing and managing psychotropic medications, monitoring for side effects and efficacy; providing brief psychotherapy and counseling; coordinating care with other healthcare providers, including primary care physicians, therapists, and case managers; documenting all patient encounters accurately and timely in the electronic health record (EHR); participating in quality improvement initiatives; adhering to all HIPAA regulations and ethical guidelines; staying current with advancements in psychiatric and mental health care; and providing crisis intervention services as needed.

Requirements: Master's or Doctoral degree in Nursing from an accredited program; current and unrestricted Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner (PMHNP) certification; active and unrestricted RN and APRN licenses in the state of operation (and potentially other states as required by company needs); minimum of 2 years of experience as a practicing PMHNP, preferably in an outpatient setting; experience providing telemedicine services preferred; strong clinical assessment and diagnostic skills; excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport with patients remotely; proficiency in using electronic health records (EHR) and other relevant technology; knowledge of psychopharmacology and evidence-based practices for mental health treatment; ability to work independently and as part of a multidisciplinary team; comfortable providing care across the lifespan; strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills; and ability to maintain confidentiality and ethical standards.

The Remote Patient Monitoring (RPM) Nurse Coordinator is responsible for the proactive management and coordination of care for patients enrolled in the RPM program. This individual will remotely monitor patients' vital signs and health data using telehealth technology, interpret trends, and intervene appropriately based on established protocols and physician orders. Responsibilities include: remotely monitoring patient data through RPM platforms, identifying and addressing deviations from baseline, proactively contacting patients regarding concerning data trends and providing education on self-management techniques, escalating complex medical issues to physicians and/or advanced practice providers, documenting all patient interactions and interventions accurately and comprehensively in the electronic health record (EHR), collaborating with the care team to develop and implement individualized care plans, providing ongoing support and education to patients and their families regarding RPM technology and its benefits, troubleshooting technical issues related to the RPM equipment, adhering to all HIPAA regulations and maintaining patient confidentiality, participating in quality improvement initiatives to optimize the RPM program, and staying up-to-date on current evidence-based practices in remote patient monitoring and telehealth.

Requirements: Registered Nurse (RN) with a current and unrestricted license in the state of [State]. Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) preferred. Minimum of 2 years of clinical experience in a relevant setting (e.g., chronic disease management, cardiology, pulmonology, primary care). Experience with telehealth or remote patient monitoring technologies is highly desirable. Strong assessment, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively communicate with patients, families, and colleagues remotely. Proficient computer skills, including experience with electronic health records (EHRs) and data analysis. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Strong organizational and time management skills. Ability to provide empathetic and patient-centered care in a virtual environment. Certification in relevant specialty (e.g., Certified Diabetes Educator [CDE], Certified Cardiac Nurse [CCN]) is a plus.

Provides remote mental health services to patients via secure video conferencing and telephone. This includes conducting initial assessments, developing individualized treatment plans, delivering evidence-based therapies (e.g., Cognitive Behavioral Therapy, Dialectical Behavior Therapy, Acceptance and Commitment Therapy), monitoring patient progress, and adjusting treatment plans as needed. The Telehealth Behavioral Health Therapist collaborates with other healthcare professionals to ensure integrated and holistic care.

Responsibilities include:

*   Conducting comprehensive telehealth assessments to evaluate patients' mental health needs, including diagnosis and treatment recommendations.
*   Developing and implementing individualized treatment plans tailored to the patient's specific needs and goals.
*   Providing individual, group, and family therapy via telehealth platforms.
*   Monitoring and documenting patient progress, adjusting treatment plans as necessary.
*   Maintaining accurate and up-to-date clinical records in compliance with HIPAA regulations.
*   Providing crisis intervention services as needed, including safety planning and referrals to appropriate resources.
*   Collaborating with other healthcare professionals, including psychiatrists, primary care physicians, and case managers, to ensure coordinated care.
*   Staying current on best practices in telehealth and evidence-based therapies.
*   Participating in clinical supervision and continuing education activities.
*   Troubleshooting technical issues related to the telehealth platform and assisting patients with connectivity problems.

Requirements:

*   Master's or Doctoral degree in social work, counseling, psychology, or a related field.
*   Active and unrestricted clinical license (e.g., LCSW, LMFT, LPC, Psychologist) in the state where the patient is located (and potentially other states, depending on organizational policy).
*   Minimum of 2 years of experience providing direct clinical services, preferably in a telehealth setting.
*   Strong clinical assessment and diagnostic skills.
*   Proficiency in evidence-based therapeutic modalities.
*   Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, including the ability to build rapport with patients remotely.
*   Comfort and proficiency using technology, including video conferencing platforms, electronic health records, and other digital tools.
*   Knowledge of HIPAA regulations and ethical guidelines related to telehealth practice.
*   Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
*   Comfort working with diverse populations and presenting mental health issues.
*   Reliable internet connection and a private, secure workspace.
*   Experience with specific patient populations or presenting problems (e.g., substance abuse, trauma, anxiety, depression) may be preferred.

job_title: Telehealth Registered Nurse - Chronic Disease Management
job_description:
The Telehealth Registered Nurse - Chronic Disease Management provides comprehensive remote patient monitoring and support to individuals managing chronic conditions such as diabetes, hypertension, heart failure, and COPD. This role utilizes telehealth technologies, including video conferencing, remote monitoring devices, and secure messaging, to assess patient health status, educate patients on self-management strategies, and coordinate care with physicians and other members of the healthcare team.

Responsibilities include:

*   Conducting virtual assessments and consultations to evaluate patients' physical and emotional health.
*   Monitoring vital signs and other relevant data collected through remote monitoring devices.
*   Developing and implementing individualized care plans in collaboration with the patient and physician.
*   Educating patients and caregivers on disease management, medication adherence, lifestyle modifications, and preventative care.
*   Providing timely interventions based on monitored data and patient reports to prevent exacerbations and hospitalizations.
*   Documenting all patient interactions, assessments, and interventions accurately and completely in the electronic health record.
*   Coordinating care with primary care physicians, specialists, and other healthcare providers as needed.
*   Providing emotional support and guidance to patients and their families.
*   Participating in quality improvement initiatives to enhance telehealth services.
*   Staying current on best practices in chronic disease management and telehealth technologies.

Requirements:

*   Active and unrestricted Registered Nurse (RN) license in the state of practice.
*   Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) preferred.
*   Minimum of 3 years of experience in nursing, with a focus on chronic disease management.
*   Experience with telehealth technologies and remote patient monitoring preferred.
*   Strong assessment, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills.
*   Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport with patients remotely.
*   Proficiency in using electronic health records (EHRs) and other healthcare software applications.
*   Ability to work independently and as part of a multidisciplinary team.
*   Comfortable working in a fast-paced, technology-driven environment.
*   Certification in Chronic Care Professional (CCP) or Certified Diabetes Educator (CDE) a plus.

The Cryptocurrency Risk Analyst is responsible for identifying, assessing, and mitigating financial and operational risks associated with the company's cryptocurrency holdings and activities. This role requires a strong understanding of blockchain technology, cryptocurrency markets, and traditional financial risk management principles.

**Responsibilities:**

*   Develop and implement risk management frameworks and policies specific to cryptocurrency assets and related activities, including custody, trading, and lending.
*   Conduct due diligence on cryptocurrency exchanges, custodians, and other third-party service providers.
*   Monitor cryptocurrency market trends, news, and regulatory developments to identify potential risks and opportunities.
*   Analyze on-chain data to detect suspicious activity, fraud, and potential security breaches.
*   Assess the risks associated with new cryptocurrency products and services.
*   Develop and maintain risk dashboards and reports for senior management.
*   Work with compliance and legal teams to ensure adherence to regulatory requirements related to cryptocurrency.
*   Participate in incident response and crisis management related to cryptocurrency events.
*   Contribute to the development of internal controls and procedures to mitigate cryptocurrency risks.
*   Stay up-to-date on emerging trends and best practices in cryptocurrency risk management.

**Requirements:**

*   Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field. Master's degree preferred.
*   3+ years of experience in risk management, preferably within the cryptocurrency or financial services industry.
*   Strong understanding of blockchain technology, cryptocurrency markets, and decentralized finance (DeFi).
*   Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, Python, SQL) and blockchain analytics platforms.
*   Experience with risk modeling and statistical analysis.
*   Knowledge of relevant regulations, such as KYC/AML, and experience with compliance procedures.
*   Excellent communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
*   Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
*   Certifications such as Certified Risk Manager (CRM) or equivalent are a plus.
*   Familiarity with smart contract security and vulnerability assessment is a plus.

The Cryptocurrency Risk Analyst is responsible for identifying, assessing, and mitigating risks associated with the company's cryptocurrency operations and holdings. This role requires a strong understanding of cryptocurrency markets, blockchain technology, regulatory compliance, and risk management principles.

**Responsibilities:**

*   Conducting ongoing risk assessments of cryptocurrency trading activities, custody solutions, lending platforms, and other DeFi protocols.
*   Developing and implementing risk management policies and procedures tailored to cryptocurrency assets, including market risk, credit risk, operational risk, and regulatory risk.
*   Monitoring cryptocurrency market trends, news, and regulatory developments to proactively identify emerging risks.
*   Performing due diligence on potential cryptocurrency investments and partnerships, assessing the security, compliance, and financial stability of counterparties.
*   Analyzing on-chain data and transaction patterns to detect suspicious activity, such as fraud, money laundering, and market manipulation.
*   Collaborating with engineering, compliance, and security teams to implement risk mitigation controls and improve the overall security posture of cryptocurrency infrastructure.
*   Preparing risk reports and presentations for management, highlighting key risks and recommending appropriate risk mitigation strategies.
*   Staying up-to-date on industry best practices and regulatory requirements related to cryptocurrency, including AML/KYC regulations.
*   Participating in the development and testing of disaster recovery and business continuity plans for cryptocurrency operations.

**Requirements:**

*   Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field. Master's degree or relevant certifications (e.g., CFA, FRM, CISA) preferred.
*   Minimum 3 years of experience in risk management, financial analysis, or compliance, with a focus on cryptocurrency or blockchain technology.
*   Strong understanding of cryptocurrency markets, trading strategies, and DeFi protocols.
*   Experience with blockchain analysis tools and on-chain data analysis techniques.
*   Familiarity with regulatory requirements related to cryptocurrency, including AML/KYC regulations.
*   Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
*   Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
*   Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Python, SQL, or Excel.
*   Knowledge of security best practices for cryptocurrency custody and wallet management.

The Cryptocurrency Risk Analyst is responsible for identifying, assessing, and mitigating risks associated with cryptocurrency trading, investment, and custody activities. This role requires a deep understanding of blockchain technology, cryptocurrency markets, and relevant regulatory frameworks.

**Responsibilities:**

*   **Risk Identification & Assessment:** Identify and assess potential risks related to cryptocurrency trading, lending, borrowing, staking, and other DeFi activities. This includes market risk, credit risk, liquidity risk, operational risk, cybersecurity risk, and regulatory risk.
*   **Risk Modeling & Measurement:** Develop and implement quantitative models and methodologies to measure and monitor cryptocurrency-related risks, including VaR, stress testing, and scenario analysis.
*   **Risk Mitigation & Control:** Design and implement risk mitigation strategies and controls, including setting risk limits, developing hedging strategies, and enhancing security protocols.
*   **Compliance & Reporting:** Ensure compliance with relevant regulations and reporting requirements, including KYC/AML procedures and reporting suspicious activity.
*   **Due Diligence:** Conduct due diligence on new cryptocurrency projects, exchanges, and DeFi platforms to assess their risk profiles.
*   **Market Monitoring:** Monitor cryptocurrency market trends, news, and events to identify potential risks and opportunities.
*   **Policy Development:** Contribute to the development and maintenance of risk management policies and procedures.
*   **Collaboration:** Collaborate with trading, engineering, compliance, and legal teams to ensure a holistic approach to risk management.
*   **Reporting:** Prepare and present risk reports to senior management and relevant committees.

**Requirements:**

*   Bachelor's or Master's degree in Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
*   Strong understanding of cryptocurrency markets, blockchain technology, and DeFi protocols.
*   Experience in risk management, preferably in a financial institution or cryptocurrency firm.
*   Proficiency in quantitative risk modeling and analysis, including statistical analysis and data manipulation.
*   Familiarity with relevant regulatory frameworks, including KYC/AML and securities regulations.
*   Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
*   Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
*   Certifications such as FRM, CFA, or CISA are a plus.
*   Experience with programming languages such as Python or R is a plus.
*   Familiarity with blockchain analytics tools is a plus.

The Cryptocurrency Risk Analyst is responsible for identifying, assessing, and mitigating financial and operational risks associated with our cryptocurrency trading and investment activities. This role requires a deep understanding of cryptocurrency markets, blockchain technology, regulatory frameworks, and risk management principles.

**Responsibilities:**

*   Develop and implement risk management strategies and policies specific to cryptocurrency trading and investment activities.
*   Monitor cryptocurrency market trends, news, and regulatory developments to identify potential risks and opportunities.
*   Conduct quantitative and qualitative risk assessments of cryptocurrency assets, trading platforms, and investment strategies.
*   Analyze on-chain data to detect suspicious activity, market manipulation, and potential fraud.
*   Develop and maintain risk dashboards and reports to track key risk indicators (KRIs) and provide timely insights to management.
*   Conduct due diligence on new cryptocurrency projects and technologies.
*   Work closely with the trading, technology, and compliance teams to ensure risk mitigation strategies are implemented effectively.
*   Stay abreast of evolving regulatory landscape and industry best practices related to cryptocurrency risk management.
*   Contribute to the development and execution of internal controls and audit procedures.
*   Prepare and present risk assessments and reports to senior management and relevant committees.

**Requirements:**

*   Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field. Master's degree preferred.
*   Minimum 3 years of experience in risk management, financial analysis, or a related field within the financial services industry, ideally with exposure to cryptocurrency or blockchain technology.
*   Strong understanding of cryptocurrency markets, blockchain technology, and decentralized finance (DeFi) concepts.
*   Proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques, including SQL, Python, or R.
*   Experience with on-chain data analysis tools and techniques is a plus.
*   Knowledge of risk management frameworks, regulatory requirements, and compliance standards related to cryptocurrency.
*   Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
*   Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
*   Certifications such as FRM, CFA, or similar risk management certifications are a plus.
*   Strong interest in the cryptocurrency space and a desire to learn and adapt to its evolving landscape.

The Cryptocurrency Portfolio Risk Analyst is responsible for identifying, analyzing, and mitigating financial risks associated with the company's cryptocurrency investment portfolio. This role requires a deep understanding of cryptocurrency markets, blockchain technology, and risk management principles. The analyst will develop and implement risk management strategies, monitor portfolio performance, and provide insights to portfolio managers to optimize risk-adjusted returns.

**Responsibilities:**

*   Develop and implement risk management frameworks and methodologies specifically tailored for cryptocurrency assets.
*   Monitor cryptocurrency market trends, news, and regulatory developments to identify potential risks and opportunities.
*   Analyze portfolio holdings and exposures to various risk factors, including market volatility, liquidity risk, counterparty risk, and regulatory risk.
*   Conduct quantitative analysis, including statistical modeling and stress testing, to assess the potential impact of adverse events on portfolio performance.
*   Develop and maintain risk dashboards and reports to communicate risk exposures and performance metrics to stakeholders.
*   Work closely with portfolio managers to develop and implement risk mitigation strategies, such as hedging and diversification.
*   Stay up-to-date on emerging cryptocurrency technologies and security best practices to ensure the portfolio's security.
*   Collaborate with compliance and legal teams to ensure adherence to relevant regulations and internal policies.
*   Perform due diligence on new cryptocurrency investments and trading platforms.
*   Participate in the development and improvement of trading strategies, incorporating risk considerations.

**Requirements:**

*   Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field. Master's degree preferred.
*   Minimum of 3 years of experience in risk management or quantitative analysis, preferably within the cryptocurrency or traditional finance industries.
*   Strong understanding of cryptocurrency markets, blockchain technology, and decentralized finance (DeFi).
*   Proficiency in statistical modeling, data analysis, and programming languages such as Python or R.
*   Experience with risk management software and tools.
*   Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
*   Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
*   Strong understanding of financial regulations relevant to cryptocurrency assets.
*   Relevant certifications such as FRM or CFA are a plus.
*   Experience with on-chain analytics and blockchain explorers is highly desirable.

The Robotics and Automation Engineer is responsible for designing, developing, testing, and implementing robotic and automated systems to improve manufacturing efficiency, safety, and quality. This individual will work closely with manufacturing engineers, production teams, and maintenance personnel to identify opportunities for automation, create detailed system specifications, and oversee the integration of robotic solutions into existing or new production lines.

**Responsibilities:**

*   Identify and evaluate opportunities to implement robotics and automation technologies in manufacturing processes.
*   Design and develop robotic workcells, including robot selection, tooling design, safety systems, and peripheral equipment.
*   Program and simulate robot movements using software such as ABB RobotStudio, FANUC Roboguide, or Siemens Process Simulate.
*   Develop and maintain documentation including system layouts, wiring diagrams, and operating procedures.
*   Oversee the installation, testing, and commissioning of robotic systems.
*   Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to robotic and automated systems.
*   Collaborate with cross-functional teams to optimize system performance and ensure seamless integration with existing infrastructure.
*   Conduct safety risk assessments and implement safety measures to ensure a safe working environment.
*   Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in robotics and automation technologies.
*   Train production and maintenance staff on the operation and maintenance of robotic systems.
*   Manage and track project budgets and timelines related to robotics and automation projects.
*   Participate in continuous improvement initiatives to enhance manufacturing processes.

**Requirements:**

*   Bachelor's degree in Robotics Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
*   3+ years of experience in robotics and automation within a manufacturing environment.
*   Proficiency in robot programming languages such as RAPID (ABB), KAREL (Fanuc), or AML (IBM).
*   Experience with PLC programming (Siemens, Allen-Bradley) is highly desirable.
*   Strong understanding of automation principles, control systems, and sensor technologies.
*   Knowledge of CAD software (e.g., AutoCAD, SolidWorks) for system design and layout.
*   Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
*   Strong communication and interpersonal skills to work effectively in a team environment.
*   Experience with vision systems and integration is a plus.
*   Experience with collaborative robots (cobots) is a plus.
*   Knowledge of safety standards and regulations related to robotics (e.g., RIA, OSHA).

The Robotics Maintenance Technician is responsible for the maintenance, troubleshooting, repair, and modification of robotic systems and automated equipment within the manufacturing facility. This individual ensures optimal performance and minimal downtime of critical automated processes.

**Responsibilities:**

*   Perform routine maintenance and preventative maintenance on robotic systems, including mechanical, electrical, and pneumatic components.
*   Diagnose and troubleshoot robotic system malfunctions, identifying root causes and implementing effective solutions.
*   Repair or replace defective robotic components, such as motors, encoders, sensors, gearboxes, and control panels.
*   Perform robotic programming and adjustments to optimize performance and efficiency.
*   Collaborate with engineers and production teams to identify areas for robotic system improvement and automation enhancements.
*   Conduct safety inspections of robotic systems and ensure compliance with safety regulations and company policies.
*   Maintain accurate records of maintenance activities, repairs, and modifications in a computerized maintenance management system (CMMS).
*   Train other technicians and production personnel on basic robotic operation and maintenance procedures.
*   Stay current with advancements in robotics technology and maintenance techniques.
*   Assist with the installation and commissioning of new robotic systems.
*   Order and manage spare parts inventory for robotic systems.

**Requirements:**

*   Associate's degree in Robotics, Mechatronics, Electrical Engineering Technology, or a related technical field; or equivalent experience.
*   Minimum 3 years of experience in maintaining and repairing industrial robotic systems.
*   Strong knowledge of robotic systems, including mechanical, electrical, pneumatic, and hydraulic components.
*   Proficiency in troubleshooting and repairing electrical circuits, PLCs, and control systems.
*   Experience with robotic programming languages (e.g., ABB RAPID, Fanuc TP, KUKA KRL) is highly desirable.
*   Ability to read and interpret technical drawings, schematics, and manuals.
*   Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
*   Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
*   Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
*   Knowledge of safety regulations and procedures related to robotic systems.
*   Physical ability to perform tasks requiring lifting, bending, and standing for extended periods.
*   Experience with CMMS software is a plus.

Robotics Integration Engineer is responsible for the successful deployment, maintenance, and optimization of robotic systems within the manufacturing facility. This role involves working collaboratively with cross-functional teams, including process engineers, maintenance technicians, and production operators, to ensure that robotic solutions enhance efficiency, improve safety, and reduce operational costs.

**Responsibilities:**

*   Design, develop, and implement robotic solutions for various manufacturing processes, including assembly, material handling, welding, painting, and packaging.

The Threat Intelligence Analyst is responsible for proactively identifying, analyzing, and disseminating actionable intelligence about cyber threats that pose a risk to the organization's infrastructure, data, and reputation. This role involves collecting and analyzing data from various sources, including open-source intelligence (OSINT), dark web forums, security blogs, and vendor threat feeds, to identify emerging threats, vulnerabilities, and attack patterns. The analyst will then correlate this information to assess the potential impact on the organization and develop mitigation strategies.

Responsibilities:

*   Collect, analyze, and correlate threat data from diverse sources (OSINT, SIEM, IDS/IPS logs, vendor threat feeds, dark web) to identify emerging threats and vulnerabilities.
*   Develop and maintain threat intelligence reports, briefings, and alerts for technical and non-technical audiences.
*   Conduct in-depth analysis of malware, phishing campaigns, and other cyberattacks to understand tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs) used by threat actors.
*   Monitor and analyze threat actor groups, campaigns, and motivations to anticipate future attacks.
*   Contribute to the development and maintenance of threat intelligence platforms and tools.
*   Collaborate with security engineers, incident responders, and other stakeholders to improve the organization's security posture.
*   Participate in security incident investigations to identify and analyze threat actor activities.
*   Stay up-to-date on the latest cybersecurity trends, threats, and technologies.
*   Present threat intelligence findings to leadership and other stakeholders.
*   Develop and maintain threat models and attack scenarios specific to the organization's environment.

Requirements:

*   Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Security, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
*   Minimum of 3 years of experience in cybersecurity with a focus on threat intelligence, incident response, or security analysis.
*   Strong understanding of cybersecurity threats, vulnerabilities, and attack vectors.
*   Experience with threat intelligence platforms (TIPs) and security information and event management (SIEM) systems.
*   Proficiency in analyzing malware, network traffic, and system logs.
*   Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
*   Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
*   Knowledge of scripting languages such as Python or Perl.
*   Familiarity with common security frameworks (e.g., MITRE ATT&CK, Cyber Kill Chain).
*   Industry certifications such as Certified Threat Intelligence Analyst (CTIA), Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), or GIAC Certified Incident Handler (GCIH) are a plus.

*   Knowledge of FDA regulations, GCP guidelines, and other applicable regulatory requirements.
*   Experience with database lock and data transfer procedures.
*   Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).

The Medical Science Liaison (MSL) - Oncology is a field-based, non-promotional scientific expert who serves as a key clinical and scientific resource to healthcare professionals (HCPs) and internal stakeholders within a defined geographic territory. The MSL is responsible for proactively identifying, developing, and maintaining collaborative relationships with key opinion leaders (KOLs), investigators, and other influential HCPs in the oncology field. They will facilitate scientific exchange by providing balanced, objective, and scientifically rigorous information about the company’s oncology portfolio, including marketed products and investigational compounds.

**Responsibilities:**

*   **KOL Engagement:** Identify, profile, develop, and maintain strong, collaborative relationships with KOLs in oncology within assigned territory.
*   **Scientific Exchange:** Engage in non-promotional scientific discussions with HCPs to address unsolicited requests for information about the company’s oncology products and research.
*   **Data Dissemination:** Present scientific data, clinical information, and research findings to HCPs at medical meetings, conferences, and other venues.
*   **Clinical Trial Support:** Identify potential investigators for clinical trials and provide support to clinical development teams by identifying appropriate patient populations and facilitating investigator-initiated research (IISR) proposals.
*   **Internal Training:** Provide scientific and clinical training to internal stakeholders, including sales representatives, marketing teams, and medical affairs colleagues.
*   **Competitive Intelligence:** Gather and communicate competitive intelligence from the field to inform internal strategies.
*   **Advisory Boards:** Support the planning and execution of advisory board meetings.
*   **Compliance:** Ensure all activities are conducted in compliance with relevant laws, regulations, and ethical guidelines, including those related to PhRMA guidelines and the company's code of conduct.
*   **Documentation:** Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all interactions and activities in a CRM system.

**Requirements:**

*   Advanced degree in a scientific field (e.g., PharmD, PhD, MD) with a strong background in oncology.
*   Minimum 2-3 years of experience as an MSL or equivalent experience in a related field (e.g., clinical research, medical affairs).
*   In-depth knowledge of oncology disease states, treatment paradigms, and clinical trial methodology.
*   Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
*   Ability to critically evaluate scientific literature and present complex data in a clear and concise manner.
*   Demonstrated ability to build and maintain strong relationships with KOLs.
*   Strong understanding of the pharmaceutical industry, regulatory environment, and compliance requirements.
*   Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
*   Valid driver's license and ability to travel extensively within assigned territory.
*   Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and CRM systems.

The Clinical Trial Data Manager is responsible for the complete and accurate management of clinical trial data, from study setup through database lock and reporting. This role ensures data integrity, consistency, and compliance with regulatory requirements (e.g., GCP, FDA) and company SOPs.

**Responsibilities:**

*   Develop and maintain data management plans (DMP) in collaboration with study teams.
*   Design and develop electronic case report forms (eCRFs) using EDC systems (e.g., Medidata Rave, Oracle Clinical).
*   Configure and validate database systems to ensure data accuracy and integrity.
*   Create and execute data validation procedures, including edit checks and manual review, to identify discrepancies and inconsistencies.
*   Review and query clinical data to resolve data issues in collaboration with clinical sites and monitors.
*   Track query resolution and ensure timely follow-up.
*   Perform data reconciliation activities, including SAE reconciliation, lab data reconciliation, and third-party data reconciliation.
*   Generate and review data listings, summary tables, and reports for data quality assessment.
*   Participate in study team meetings to provide data management updates and address data-related issues.
*   Contribute to the development and improvement of data management processes and SOPs.
*   Perform database lock activities, including data review, audit trail review, and generation of lock documentation.
*   Archive study data in compliance with company policy and regulatory requirements.
*   Potentially manage and mentor junior data management staff.

**Requirements:**

*   Bachelor's degree in a scientific field (e.g., biology, chemistry, statistics) or equivalent experience.
*   Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in clinical data management within the pharmaceutical industry or CRO.
*   Proficiency in using EDC systems (e.g., Medidata Rave, Oracle Clinical).
*   Strong understanding of clinical trial processes and GCP guidelines.
*   Experience in developing and implementing data management plans.
*   Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
*   Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
*   Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
*   Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
*   Knowledge of data standards (e.g., CDASH, SDTM) is a plus.
*   Experience with SAS programming is a plus.

Clinical Data Manager is responsible for the integrity and quality of clinical trial data. This individual oversees the data management aspects of clinical trials from study start-up through database lock and final analysis. Responsibilities include developing and maintaining data management plans, CRF/eCRF design and review, database build and testing, data validation and cleaning, and ensuring compliance with GCP, FDA, and company SOPs. The Clinical Data Manager collaborates closely with other functional areas such as clinical operations, biostatistics, and programming. They are expected to identify and resolve data issues, contribute to the development of data standards, and participate in the preparation of study reports. Requires a Bachelor's degree in a scientific field (e.g., biology, chemistry, statistics, or a related field) with 3+ years of experience in clinical data management within the pharmaceutical industry. Experience with EDC systems (e.g., Medidata Rave, Oracle InForm) is essential. Strong organizational, communication, and problem-solving skills are required. Knowledge of CDISC standards (SDTM, ADaM) is preferred.

The Clinical Data Manager is responsible for the planning, development, and execution of data management activities for clinical trials conducted by the pharmaceutical company. This role ensures the integrity, quality, and compliance of clinical trial data according to regulatory guidelines (e.g., GCP, FDA) and standard operating procedures (SOPs). Responsibilities include: developing and maintaining data management plans (DMPs); designing and validating electronic Case Report Forms (eCRFs); creating and executing data validation specifications (edit checks); performing data reconciliation activities between clinical and safety databases; managing data queries and ensuring timely resolution; coding medical terms using standard coding dictionaries (e.g., MedDRA, WHODrug); participating in database lock activities; generating data listings and reports; contributing to the development of standard data management procedures and workflows; collaborating with cross-functional teams including clinical operations, biostatistics, and medical writing; and ensuring the security and confidentiality of patient data.

Requirements: Bachelor's degree in a scientific or related field (e.g., biology, chemistry, mathematics, statistics, computer science); minimum of 3-5 years of experience in clinical data management within the pharmaceutical industry or a CRO; thorough understanding of clinical trial processes and regulatory requirements (GCP, FDA); proficiency in using clinical data management systems (CDMS) such as Medidata Rave, Oracle Clinical, or Veeva Vault CDMS; experience with medical coding dictionaries (MedDRA, WHODrug); strong analytical and problem-solving skills; excellent communication and interpersonal skills; ability to work independently and as part of a team; and a commitment to data quality and integrity. Experience with EDC system build and validation is highly desirable.

The Investment Banking Analyst, Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A), will be a key member of a deal team executing complex M&A transactions across various industries. This position offers a unique opportunity to gain significant exposure to all aspects of the M&A process, from initial pitch development to deal closing.

**Responsibilities:**

*   **Financial Analysis & Modeling:** Construct and analyze financial models, including valuation models (DCF, precedent transactions, market multiples), merger models, and LBO models, to assess deal feasibility and pricing.
*   **Due Diligence:** Conduct thorough due diligence on target companies, analyzing financial statements, industry reports, and company data to identify key risks and opportunities.
*   **Transaction Execution:** Assist in the preparation of transaction documents, including pitch books, information memorandums (IMs), management presentations, and term sheets.
*   **Market Research:** Conduct comprehensive market research to identify potential buyers and sellers, analyze industry trends, and assess competitive landscapes.
*   **Client Interaction:** Assist senior bankers in client meetings and presentations, providing support and contributing to discussions.
*   **Deal Management:** Support the overall deal execution process, coordinating with legal, accounting, and other advisors.
*   **Mentorship:** Opportunity to work alongside experienced investment bankers and receive mentorship to accelerate professional development.
*   **Compliance:** Adhere to all regulatory requirements and ethical standards.

**Requirements:**

*   Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field.
*   Strong academic record with a minimum GPA of 3.5 preferred.
*   Excellent financial modeling and analytical skills, including proficiency in Excel.
*   Solid understanding of financial accounting principles and valuation methodologies.
*   Strong written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to present complex information clearly and concisely.
*   Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, demanding environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
*   Detail-oriented, highly motivated, and a strong team player.
*   Prior internship experience in investment banking, private equity, or related financial services is preferred.
*   Series 79 and Series 63 licenses (or willingness to obtain within a specified timeframe) are a plus.
*   Proficiency in using financial databases such as Bloomberg, Capital IQ, and FactSet is advantageous.

Investment Banking Associates are integral members of deal teams, working on a variety of transactions, including mergers and acquisitions (M&A), debt and equity offerings, and restructuring assignments. Responsibilities include: building financial models and performing valuation analyses (DCF, precedent transactions, comparable companies); conducting industry and company-specific research; preparing presentations and pitchbooks for clients and internal audiences; managing due diligence processes; drafting offering documents (prospectuses, private placement memorandums); and assisting in transaction execution. Candidates should possess a strong academic record, preferably with a Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting, or a related field. Prior experience in investment banking, private equity, consulting, or corporate finance through internships or prior full-time roles is highly desirable. Excellent analytical, quantitative, and communication skills are essential, as is proficiency in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word. The ideal candidate is a highly motivated, detail-oriented individual with a strong work ethic and the ability to work effectively under pressure in a fast-paced environment. Series 79 and Series 63 licenses (or the ability to obtain them within a specified timeframe) may be required.

The Investment Banking Analyst role within the Technology Group is a demanding yet rewarding entry-level position responsible for supporting senior bankers in executing a variety of transactions, including mergers and acquisitions, equity offerings, and debt financings, for technology companies. The Analyst will work on multiple projects concurrently, requiring strong analytical, quantitative, and communication skills.

**Responsibilities:**

*   **Financial Modeling & Valuation:** Constructing and maintaining complex financial models to value companies and assess the financial impact of potential transactions. This includes discounted cash flow (DCF) analysis, comparable company analysis, precedent transaction analysis, and leveraged buyout (LBO) modeling.
*   **Market Research & Due Diligence:** Conducting thorough market research, industry analysis, and company-specific due diligence to support transaction structuring and investment recommendations. This includes gathering information from public sources, industry databases, and expert interviews.
*   **Transaction Execution:** Assisting in all aspects of transaction execution, including preparing pitch books, confidential information memorandums (CIMs), management presentations, and other transaction-related documents.
*   **Client Communication & Relationship Management:** Participating in client meetings and maintaining strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
*   **Industry Knowledge:** Developing a deep understanding of the technology industry landscape, including key trends, competitive dynamics, and regulatory considerations.
*   **Administrative Support:** Providing general support to senior bankers, including scheduling meetings, managing data rooms, and coordinating logistics.

**Requirements:**

*   Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting, or a related quantitative field with a strong academic record.
*   Excellent analytical, quantitative, and problem-solving skills.
*   Proficiency in financial modeling, valuation techniques, and Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Word).
*   Strong communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills.
*   Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, demanding environment and manage multiple projects concurrently.
*   Demonstrated interest in investment banking and the technology industry.
*   Ability to work both independently and collaboratively as part of a team.
*   Exceptional attention to detail and a commitment to accuracy.
*   Series 79 and Series 63 licenses (or willingness to obtain them shortly after hire).

As an Investment Banking Associate, you will play a critical role in supporting senior bankers in executing a variety of transactions, including mergers and acquisitions (M&A), leveraged buyouts (LBOs), debt and equity offerings, and restructurings. You will be responsible for conducting in-depth financial analysis, developing complex financial models, preparing pitch books and client presentations, managing due diligence processes, and coordinating with legal counsel and other advisors. As an Investment Banking Associate, you will play a crucial role in supporting senior bankers in the execution of mergers and acquisitions (M&A), capital market transactions (e.g., IPOs, debt offerings), and other strategic advisory services for our clients. The Manufacturing Engineer - Body Shop is responsible for supporting and improving the manufacturing processes within the body shop, ensuring efficient and high-quality vehicle assembly. This role involves troubleshooting production issues, implementing process improvements, and supporting the launch of new vehicle models. Responsibilities include:

*   **Process Optimization:** Analyzing existing manufacturing processes, identifying bottlenecks and inefficiencies, and developing solutions to improve throughput, reduce cycle times, and minimize waste.
*   **Equipment Support:** Providing technical support for automated welding systems, material handling equipment, and other automated assembly lines within the body shop. This includes troubleshooting equipment malfunctions, performing preventative maintenance, and working with maintenance technicians to resolve complex issues.
*   **New Model Launch:** Participating in the planning and execution of new vehicle model launches, ensuring smooth integration of new processes and equipment into the existing production line. This includes designing tooling, developing work instructions, and validating process capabilities.
*   **Problem Solving:** Investigating and resolving production issues using root cause analysis techniques (e.g., 5 Whys, Fishbone diagrams). Implementing corrective and preventative actions to prevent recurrence.
*   **Quality Control:** Working with quality engineers to identify and address quality concerns within the body shop. Developing and implementing process controls to ensure consistent product quality.
*   **Continuous Improvement:** Championing continuous improvement initiatives (e.g., Lean Manufacturing, Six Sigma) to drive operational excellence within the body shop.
*   **Documentation:** Creating and maintaining accurate documentation of manufacturing processes, including work instructions, process flow diagrams, and equipment manuals.
*   **Collaboration:** Collaborating effectively with other departments, including production, maintenance, quality, and engineering, to achieve common goals.
*   **Safety:** Ensuring adherence to all safety regulations and procedures within the body shop. Identifying and addressing potential safety hazards.

**Requirements:**

*   Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, Industrial Engineering, or a related field.
*   3+ years of experience in a manufacturing environment, preferably within the automotive industry and specifically within a body shop or welding environment.
*   Strong knowledge of manufacturing processes, including welding, stamping, assembly, and automation.
*   Experience with Lean Manufacturing principles and tools (e.g., Value Stream Mapping, Kaizen).
*   Proficiency in CAD software (e.g., AutoCAD, SolidWorks).
*   Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
*   Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
*   Ability to work effectively in a team environment.
*   Experience with robotic welding systems (e.g., Fanuc, ABB) is a plus.
*   Six Sigma certification (Green Belt or Black Belt) is a plus.

Responsible for developing, implementing, and optimizing manufacturing processes within the body assembly department. This includes designing and improving production layouts, tooling, and equipment to enhance efficiency, reduce waste, and ensure product quality. The Manufacturing Engineer will troubleshoot production issues, perform root cause analysis, and implement corrective actions. They will also collaborate with cross-functional teams, including design engineering, quality control, and maintenance, to ensure seamless integration of new models and technologies into the existing production line. Key responsibilities include creating and maintaining process documentation (work instructions, PFMEAs, control plans), conducting time studies and capacity analysis, and participating in continuous improvement initiatives such as Lean manufacturing and Six Sigma projects.

Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, or a related field. 3+ years of experience in an automotive manufacturing environment, specifically within body assembly. Proven experience with process optimization, tooling design, and automation. Strong understanding of Lean manufacturing principles and Six Sigma methodologies. Proficiency in CAD software (e.g., AutoCAD, CATIA) and statistical analysis tools (e.g., Minitab). Excellent problem-solving, communication, and teamwork skills. Knowledge of welding processes (resistance welding, laser welding) and robotics is highly desirable. Experience with PLC programming is a plus. Must be able to work independently and as part of a team to meet project deadlines and achieve performance targets.

The Manufacturing Engineer - Assembly Process Optimization is responsible for improving the efficiency, quality, and safety of automotive assembly processes. This role involves analyzing current processes, identifying areas for improvement, designing and implementing solutions, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration.

**Responsibilities:**

*   Analyze existing assembly processes using Lean Manufacturing principles (e.g., Value Stream Mapping, 5S, Kaizen) to identify waste, bottlenecks, and inefficiencies.
*   Develop and implement process improvements to optimize cycle times, reduce scrap rates, improve ergonomics, and enhance overall assembly line performance.
*   Design and specify tooling, fixtures, and equipment required for improved assembly processes.
*   Create and maintain detailed process documentation, including work instructions, standard operating procedures (SOPs), and process flow diagrams.
*   Conduct time studies and motion analysis to identify opportunities for workstation optimization and operator training.
*   Lead or participate in root cause analysis investigations to address quality issues and implement corrective actions.
*   Collaborate with design engineering, quality control, and production teams to ensure new product designs are manufacturable and assembly-friendly.
*   Develop and implement preventative maintenance programs for assembly equipment.
*   Support the implementation of new technologies and automation solutions to improve assembly line efficiency.
*   Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) related to assembly processes and track the effectiveness of implemented improvements.
*   Ensure compliance with safety regulations and promote a safe working environment.

**Requirements:**

*   Bachelor's degree in Manufacturing Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, or a related field.
*   Minimum 3 years of experience in manufacturing engineering, preferably within the automotive industry.
*   Proven experience in process improvement methodologies, such as Lean Manufacturing, Six Sigma, or similar.
*   Strong understanding of assembly processes, tooling, and equipment.
*   Proficiency in CAD software (e.g., AutoCAD, SolidWorks) for designing fixtures and tooling.
*   Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
*   Strong communication, interpersonal, and teamwork skills.
*   Knowledge of statistical process control (SPC) and data analysis techniques.
*   Experience with PLC programming and automation systems is a plus.
*   Experience with robotic assembly systems is a plus.

Responsible for developing, implementing, and optimizing manufacturing processes for Body in White (BIW) operations in an automotive manufacturing facility. This includes overseeing welding, joining, and assembly processes to ensure quality, efficiency, and cost-effectiveness. The Manufacturing Engineer will lead problem-solving activities related to BIW issues, implement continuous improvement initiatives, and work closely with cross-functional teams (quality, production, maintenance, and design) to achieve production targets.

**Responsibilities:**

*   Develop and implement efficient and robust BIW manufacturing processes, including welding parameters, fixture design, and material handling procedures.
*   Optimize existing processes to improve throughput, reduce scrap rates, and minimize downtime.
*   Lead problem-solving activities related to BIW defects, process variations, and equipment malfunctions.
*   Conduct root cause analysis and implement corrective actions to prevent recurrence of issues.
*   Design and/or oversee the design of tooling, fixtures, and equipment for BIW operations.
*   Work with suppliers to ensure quality and on-time delivery of BIW components.
*   Develop and maintain process documentation, including work instructions, standard operating procedures (SOPs), and process flow diagrams.
*   Participate in new product launches and ensure smooth integration of new BIW designs into the production line.
*   Collaborate with quality engineers to ensure compliance with quality standards and specifications.
*   Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and implement strategies to improve overall BIW performance.
*   Train production personnel on new processes and equipment.
*   Implement lean manufacturing principles and techniques to eliminate waste and improve efficiency.

**Requirements:**

*   Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, or a related field.
*   3+ years of experience in automotive manufacturing, specifically in Body in White operations.
*   Strong knowledge of welding processes (e.g., resistance spot welding, MIG/MAG welding, laser welding) and joining techniques.
*   Experience with robotic automation and programming.
*   Proficiency in CAD software (e.g., AutoCAD, CATIA).
*   Experience with statistical process control (SPC) and data analysis.
*   Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
*   Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
*   Knowledge of lean manufacturing principles and techniques.
*   Experience with GD&T (Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing).
*   Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
*   Experience with PFMEA (Process Failure Mode and Effects Analysis) preferred.

As an Automotive Quality Engineer, you will be responsible for ensuring the quality and reliability of automotive components and systems throughout the manufacturing process. This role involves developing and implementing quality control procedures, identifying and analyzing defects, and working collaboratively with engineering, production, and supplier teams to implement corrective and preventative actions.

**Responsibilities:**

*   Develop and implement quality control plans and procedures based on industry standards (e.g., IATF 16949, APQP, PPAP).
*   Conduct process audits and inspections to identify non-conformances and opportunities for improvement.
*   Analyze quality data, including statistical process control (SPC) charts, to identify trends and potential issues.
*   Lead root cause analysis investigations for defects and failures, utilizing tools such as 8D methodology, 5 Whys, and Fishbone diagrams.
*   Work with suppliers to ensure they meet quality standards and resolve any quality-related issues.
*   Participate in design reviews to identify potential quality concerns early in the product development cycle.
*   Develop and conduct training programs for production staff on quality control procedures and best practices.
*   Prepare and present quality reports to management.
*   Ensure compliance with all applicable safety and environmental regulations.
*   Continuously improve quality processes and procedures to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
*   Manage and maintain calibration schedules for measuring equipment.

**Requirements:**

*   Bachelor's degree in Engineering (Mechanical, Electrical, Industrial, or related field) required.
*   3+ years of experience in quality engineering within the automotive manufacturing industry.
*   Strong knowledge of quality management systems (e.g., IATF 16949).
*   Proficiency in using quality tools and techniques, such as SPC, FMEA, MSA, and Root Cause Analysis.
*   Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
*   Strong communication, interpersonal, and teamwork skills.
*   Ability to read and interpret technical drawings and specifications.
*   Experience with APQP and PPAP processes.
*   Proficiency in using statistical software packages (e.g., Minitab).
*   Knowledge of GD&T (Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing) is preferred.
*   Certifications such as Certified Quality Engineer (CQE) or Certified Six Sigma Black Belt (CSSBB) are a plus.

Develop and implement visual merchandising strategies to maximize sales and enhance the customer shopping experience within a fast-paced retail environment. The Visual Merchandising Coordinator assists the Visual Merchandising Manager in executing creative and impactful visual displays to drive sales, enhance brand image, and provide an engaging customer experience within a high-volume fast fashion retail environment.
