*   Monitor and analyze process data to identify trends and optimize process parameters.
*   Train operators and other personnel on the operation and maintenance of chemical processes.

**Requirements:**

*   3+ years of experience in chemical process engineering in a manufacturing environment.
*   Strong understanding of chemical engineering principles, including thermodynamics, fluid mechanics, heat transfer, and mass transfer.
*   Experience with process simulation software, such as AspenTech or ChemCAD.
*   Knowledge of process safety management (PSM) principles and PHA methodologies.
*   Experience with statistical process control (SPC) and process optimization techniques.
*   Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and communication skills.
*   Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
*   Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.
*   Familiarity with relevant industry standards and regulations.
*   Experience with SAP or other enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems is a plus.

Responsible for designing, developing, and implementing chemical processes to optimize production efficiency, product quality, and safety within the chemical manufacturing plant. This role involves designing, developing, and implementing online courses, modules, and interactive content that help retail professionals enhance their skills and knowledge. Responsibilities include: conducting needs analysis to identify learning objectives; designing instructional materials such as videos, interactive simulations, quizzes, and assessments; collaborating with subject matter experts to ensure accuracy and relevance of content; utilizing learning management systems (LMS) to build and manage courses; incorporating accessibility best practices to ensure inclusivity for all learners; collecting and analyzing data on learner engagement and performance to continuously improve course effectiveness; staying up-to-date with the latest trends in online learning and instructional design; and providing technical support and guidance to learners.

Requirements include: Bachelor's degree in Instructional Design, Education, or a related field; minimum 3 years of experience in designing and developing online learning experiences; proficiency in using learning management systems (LMS) such as Moodle, Canvas, or Blackboard; strong knowledge of instructional design principles and methodologies (ADDIE, SAM); experience with multimedia authoring tools (e.g., Articulate Storyline, Adobe Captivate, Camtasia); excellent communication, collaboration, and project management skills; strong attention to detail and ability to work independently; and a passion for creating engaging and effective learning experiences. Experience in the retail industry or related training is a plus.

The Online Learning Experience Designer is responsible for creating engaging, effective, and accessible online learning experiences for our retail training programs. This role will collaborate with subject matter experts, instructional designers, and technology specialists to design, develop, and implement innovative online courses, modules, and resources that improve employee performance and drive business results. Responsibilities include conducting needs assessments to identify learning gaps and objectives, designing interactive and multimedia-rich learning content using various authoring tools and learning management systems (LMS), developing storyboards and scripts, selecting and integrating appropriate learning technologies, creating assessments to measure learning outcomes, and providing ongoing support and maintenance for online learning platforms. The ideal candidate will have a bachelor's degree in instructional design, education, or a related field, and at least 3 years of experience designing and developing online learning experiences. Proficiency with Articulate 360 (Storyline, Rise), Adobe Creative Suite, and common LMS platforms (e.g., Canvas, Moodle, TalentLMS) is required. Strong communication, collaboration, and project management skills are essential. Experience in the retail industry or with training on retail processes and technologies is a plus. Must be passionate about creating engaging and impactful learning experiences that empower our employees to succeed.

The Learning Experience Designer - eCommerce Specialization is responsible for designing and developing engaging and effective online learning experiences specifically tailored for retail professionals looking to expand their knowledge in eCommerce. This includes creating curriculum, interactive modules, assessments, and supplementary resources that enhance learner engagement and improve knowledge retention related to topics such as digital marketing, online merchandising, customer acquisition, data analytics for eCommerce, and platform management (e.g., Shopify, Amazon Seller Central). Responsibilities include: conducting needs analysis to identify learning objectives and target audience requirements; collaborating with subject matter experts and instructional designers to develop high-quality learning content; creating storyboards and prototypes for online modules; designing and implementing interactive learning activities, simulations, and assessments; utilizing multimedia tools (e.g., video, audio, animation) to enhance the learning experience; ensuring that all learning materials are accessible and meet accessibility standards; evaluating the effectiveness of learning programs through data analysis and feedback collection; and continuously improving learning content based on performance metrics and learner feedback.

Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Instructional Design, Education, or a related field. Proven experience in designing and developing online learning experiences, preferably within the retail or eCommerce industry. Strong understanding of adult learning principles and instructional design methodologies (e.g., ADDIE, SAM). Proficiency in using authoring tools such as Articulate Storyline, Adobe Captivate, or similar platforms. Experience with Learning Management Systems (LMS) administration and implementation. Familiarity with eCommerce platforms such as Shopify, Amazon Seller Central, or Magento is highly desirable. Excellent communication, collaboration, and project management skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. A portfolio showcasing previous online learning design projects is required. Knowledge of accessibility standards (WCAG) is a plus.
